full_text: rco-1b-c006 18:27 FROM:LIMITED BRANDS LEGAL 6144157189 TO: 912127500381 P. 4/5 Limitedbrands Victoria's Secret Stores Incident Report VSS2006015582 Printed on: 2/15/2006 Investigation Note: Colon verified XBR and found several suspicious returns on 10/30 and 11/2/05 totaling approximately $210.00. During the course of the interview it did not admit to any fraudulent refunds. On 11/4/05 RLPM Colon spoke to an associate by the name of Shayna Casdorph and she stated that she observed several items of VSS merchandise in car one day. The items found were Halo Perfume, tank top, bras, panties and accessories. Summations: Hall resigned at the conclusion of interview and Co Manager keyed termination as not rehireable for policy violation. text_blocks.content: Limitedbrands Victoria's Secret Stores Incident Report VSS2006015582

Colon verified XBR and found several suspicious returns on 10/30 and 11/2/05 totaling approximately $210.00. During the course of the interview it did not admit to any fraudulent refunds. On 11/4/05 RLPM Colon spoke to an associate by the name of Shayna Casdorph and she stated that she observed several items of VSS merchandise in car one day. The items found were Halo Perfume, tank top, bras, panties and accessories.
Loss/Recovery: Direct Loss: $209.00 Amount Recovered: $209.00 Indirect Loss: $0.00 Net Loss: $0.00
This report is the property of Limited Brands and is subject to all attorney/client protection. It may not be duplicated or reproduced without the express written consent of Limited Brands.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a scanned incident report from Victoria's Secret Stores. The report details an investigation into suspicious returns and merchandise found in an associate's car. The document is marked as 'Page 4/5' and has a handwritten note in the investigation section.
